direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods generate financial identifiers (credit card numbers and IBANs) but for different purposes.
Both methods generate financial identifiers (credit card numbers and BIC codes) but for different purposes.
Both methods generate financial identifiers (credit card numbers and routing numbers) but for different purposes.
Both methods involve complex calculations (Luhn algorithm for credit cards and IBAN checksum calculation) with similar control flows and exception handling.
Both methods involve summing digits of a number, which is a common operation in financial validation algorithms.
Both methods involve string manipulation, specifically padding strings with zeros, which is a common operation in financial formatting.
The method is directly called by creditCard() to determine the type of credit card to generate, indicating a strong dependency.
The method is used to resolve keys for generating credit card numbers, indicating a dependency on the underlying data resolution mechanism.
